msgSnippet: Thanks!  talk about somebody who s not afraid to release usefull code even if it s not perfect! I like that. mathieu PS: don t forget to mention the license if

Thanks!  talk about somebody who's not afraid to release usefull code even
if it's not perfect! I like that.

mathieu

PS: don't forget to mention the license if you want the code to be under a
certain license...

----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Rogers
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Tuesday, June 12, 2001 2:01 PM
Subject: RE: VAJ metric utility (was: [junit] Best Practice for Tests ?)


I have checked with my bosses and I don't see that it will be much of a
problem.  The only thing is that it is in a state of flux.  I will post the
working copy.  My current copy has gone through a lot of refactoring, but
isn't finished.  The copy I post will not have any separation of
model/view/controller since it was never meant to be distributed (it was a
two day proof-of-concept).  However, that being said, this is the copy that
we have been using for three months.  I will also include a readme for
getting this installed in VAJ.

-Jason

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Mathieu Gervais [mailto:egoine_@...]
    > Sent: Tuesday, June 12, 2001 8:42 AM
    > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    > Subject: Re:VAJ metric utility (was: [junit] Best
    > Practice for Tests ?)
    >
    >
    > From: Jason Rogers
    > [...]
    > >Well put!  This is something I have often alluded to in
    > my own company, but
    > >still eludes me frequently.  For that reason I wrote a
    > utility that
    > >integrates with VAJ to keep the metrics coming as far as
    > what is tested and
    > >what is not.  This is not a code coverage analysis; all
    > it does is report
    > on
    > >which classes are tested and which are not, and of the
    > ones that are - how
    > >much of their public interface is tested.
    >
    > Would you be willing to publish such an utility. I think
    > it might be usefull
    > to the community. (At least I know _I_ wanted to write
    > something that list
    > which class has a TestClass written for and which don't).
    > Your stuff looks
    > cool.
    >
    > mathieu
